LOADSCREENHINT.szName: This template should never show up
Most machineguns have replacable barrels. Use this to rapidly cool down your gun during combat.
Use your knife on a corpse to retrieve its uniform, or pick up the corpse.
Spies can use enemy uniforms to disguise as soldiers.
You can toggle between different scopes and sights by pressing'.'.
Leaving food around for a few days will spoil it, making it unhealthy.
You can clean poisoning by taking an antidote, or the DOCTOR assignment.
If a 'M' appears on your gun, that means it is currently mounted onto something, resulting in better stability.
Don't forget to check out Jagged Alliance: Flashback on Kickstarter!
Don't be lame! Drop backpacks with [SHIFT]+[B] in tactical to enhance movement and enable climbing.
Need help? Help yourself by pressing [H] in strategic screen. And visit the helping bears at www.ja-galaxy-forum.com
Turn the wheel to your fortune. Increase Chance To Hit in all fire modes with the mouse [WHEEL]. [ALT]+[WHEEL] sets size of auto-fire volley.

Facilities granted. Some sectors offer facilities like bars or mines that you can assign mercs to in strategical. Tool tips hinting at facility's function appear when assigning a merc just like you'd assign a merc to repairing, doctoring or training militia.

Guild of Thieves. Steal opponent's gun with the hand-cursor [CTRL]+[LEFTCLICK]. If enemy is kissing the dust in a non-dying state you may strip off really everything carried including additional ammo and armour.
EOD flag signals. Mind you, the blue flag you may put in a tile on ground to mark a mine or trap you've spotted is also seen and reacted to by the enemy.
Colour your vision! Holding [END] in tactical shows currently selected merc's detailed field of vision, ranging from red (don't spot nobody) to green (spot even somebody lying in the grass).
Red Alert! Holding [DEL] in tactical shows where enemies you know of may see currently selected merc, ranging from red (will be seen even prone) to green (perfect concealment).
Jagged windowing. Shoot the glass (where necessary), face the open window and climb through it with [SHIFT]+[J].
While in sector inventory, click empty inventory slots for a list of items you may want to put there.
While in sector inventory, click empty attachment slots for a list of compatible attachments.
While in sector inventory, [ctrl]-click empty inventory slots for a categorized list of items in that sector.
When choosing items via popup menus (accessible through clicking empty inventory/attachment slots), least damaged items are used.
Press [ctrl]-[shift]-[x] to enable real-time sneaking. When active, you won't enter turn-based mode when you spot enemy soldiers - as long as they are not alerted of your presence.
Press [ctrl]-[x] to enter turn-based mode while real-time sneaking is active. Only works when you see enemy soldiers.
